translation.en: [Attenborough] The natural world is full of colours.
Colours that attract attention.
Colours that blend beautifully with their background.
And colours that create extraordinary displays.
There are few animals more brilliantly coloured
than these scarlet macaws.
Animals can use colour for all kinds of different reasons,
and some have colours that we ourselves can't even see.
translation.ko: 심지어 어떤 색은 우리 눈에 보이지도 않습니다

translation.en: But with new cameras,
some developed especially for this series,
we can reveal a world that has long been hidden from our eyes.
translation.ko: 우리 눈에 보이지 않던 세계를 파헤쳐 봅니다

translation.en: A world of colours that only some animals can see.
Secret communication channels for the most private of messages.
translation.ko: 그들만의 소통 경로에서 비밀스레 주고받던 이야기까지

translation.en: And colours so bold and brilliant, they dazzle our senses.
translation.ko: 대담하고 다채로운 색깔은 우리 감각을 현혹시킵니다

translation.en: Whether to win a mate…
or beat a rival,
to warn off an enemy
or to hide from one.
We will reveal extraordinary stories about Life in Colour.
translation.ko: '생명의 색을 찾아서'와 함께 이 놀라운 이야기를 알아봅시다

translation.en: The rocky hills of Southern India.
The stage is set for a performance
of one of the most spectacular dances in the natural world.
Peacocks are gathering.
This, surely,
is one of the most glamorous of all sights in nature.
A hundred and fifty shimmering eyespots,
carried on tail feathers that are six feet long.
translation.ko: 180cm나 되는 꼬리 깃털이 가위 장관을 이룹니다

translation.en: So how did such glories evolve?
It seems it's all down to the female.
The brighter a male's colours
and the greater the number of his feathery eyespots,
the more attractive she will find him.
But colours and plumes like these come at a cost.
translation.ko: 하지만 이런 아름다움에는 그만한 대가가 따릅니다

translation.en: The immense tail makes flying difficult.
The males are literally weighed down by their feathers.
translation.ko: 수컷들은 말 그대로 깃털에 짓눌려 삽니다

translation.en: Yet the colours they carry are clearly very important to them.
translation.ko: 그 와중에 색깔도 두말할 것 없이 중요합니다

translation.en: So why and how has colour taken on such value?
To understand that,
we have to think back to when it all began.
Seven hundred million years ago,
our planet was far less colourful.
But the first animals, it seems,
had eyes that were unable to distinguish colours anyway.
Gradually, however, this changed.
I am in Costa Rica…
a good place to see how valuable colour can be.
This toucan likes fruit,
and its ability to choose ripe fruit from unripe depends on colour,
translation.ko: 과일이 잘 익었는지 색을 보고 판단할 줄 알죠

translation.en: because the ripe ones are black.
And this capacity of choosing between different colours
translation.ko: 서로 다른 색을 보고 구별하는 능력은

translation.en: was a very important stage in the evolution of colour vision.
Birds,
close relatives of dinosaurs,
appeared before mammals.
The first mammals, as far as we can tell,
translation.ko: 우리가 알 수 있는 최초의 포유류는

translation.en: were mostly nocturnal.
Colours are not easily distinguishable at night,
translation.ko: 밤에는 쉽게 색상을 구별할 수 없으니

translation.en: so why evolve the ability to detect them?
translation.ko: 색을 감지하는 능력을 발달시킬 이유도 없죠

translation.en: So it seems that the first mammals themselves
were not very colourful.
And this is still largely true today.
Most are shades of black and white.
Or brown.
But there are exceptions.
And one of the most dramatic
translation.ko: 강렬한 색채를 자랑하는 동물이 가봉의 숲에 살기 때문이죠

translation.en: lives in the forests of Gabon in West Africa.
translation.ko: 강렬한 색채를 자랑하는 동물이 가봉의 숲에 살기 때문이죠 서아프리카로 떠나 봅시다

translation.en: These monkeys are mandrills, a kind of baboon.
They live in large troops.
Most are females and youngsters,
both of which are brown.
But the males are different.
They, when they're young,
have very plain faces with naked muzzles.
translation.ko: 코와 주둥이 부분이 색 없이 밋밋합니다

translation.en: As they grow, their faces begin to change.
Testosterone begins to flow through their veins.
When they're about six years old,
they leave the troop and start to fend for themselves.
As they become sexually mature,
colour appears in their faces.
And what colour!
Mandrill males are the biggest of all monkeys,
translation.ko: 수컷 맨드릴개코원숭이는 원숭이 중 가장 몸집이 큽니다

translation.en: weighing over 30 kilos.
Enormously, frighteningly powerful.
And their colours say so.
It is not only his face which is coloured.
So is his rump.
Both are fearless declarations
of his health and strength.
And this male is more than happy to prove just how strong he is
translation.ko: 이 수컷은 기꺼이 자신의 힘을 과시하며

translation.en: should any male dare to challenge him.
Not surprisingly,
mandrill eyes are particularly sensitive to colour.
And it's the brightness of their colours which signals their status.
translation.ko: 색의 밝기를 보면 지위를 가늠할 수 있죠

translation.en: There are four males in this troop,
and they're constantly flexing their muscles
and displaying their colours to establish who is the strongest.
translation.ko: 끊임없이 힘을 과시하고 색을 뽐내며 가장 강한 수컷의 자리를 놓고 싸웁니다

translation.en: And not all disputes are settled peacefully.
They emphasise their ferocity by gestures,
such as grinding their teeth.
If that doesn't work,
the highest-ranking male will fight…
and the others know it.
It's better to let colour do the talking.
Mandrills see the world much as we do
translation.ko: 맨드릴개코원숭이는 인간과 비슷한 수준으로 색을 식별하고

translation.en: and have three kinds of colour-sensitive cells.
But another group of animals has colour vision that's far superior
translation.ko: 색각 능력이 훨씬 뛰어난 동물들도 있습니다

translation.en: to that of any mammal.
Birds.
Their ability varies from group to group,
but you can judge how good they are
translation.ko: 서로에게 신호를 보내는 데 사용하는 색상에서

translation.en: from the colours they use to signal to one another.
translation.ko: 서로에게 신호를 보내는 데 사용하는 색상에서 그 능력을 가늠할 수 있습니다

translation.en: [whispering] Hummingbirds have excellent colour vision,
because that enables them to spot brightly coloured flowers,
translation.ko: 그도 그럴 것이 형형색색의 꽃을 찾을 줄 알아야

translation.en: which contains the nectar on which they feed.
translation.ko: 먹이인 꿀을 얻을 수 있기 때문이죠

translation.en: So this artificial feeder is a big success.
translation.ko: 그러니까 이 인공 사료기는 꽤 성공적인 편이에요

translation.en: Brightly coloured down here
and containing sugar solution, artificial nectar, up there.
translation.ko: 위쪽에는 당액 즉 인공 꿀을 넣어 놨죠

translation.en: But hummingbirds also use their ability to see colour in a different way,
translation.ko: 벌새는 또 다른 방식으로 색각 능력을 활용하기도 합니다

translation.en: to attract a mate.
Most species live in South America,
where there are flowers of some sort all year round.
translation.ko: 1년 내내 꿀을 얻을 수 있기 때문이죠

translation.en: A few, however, have spread northwards
into the deserts of the American Southwest.
In this vastness,
it's hard to get noticed,
especially if you're a small hummingbird looking for a mate.
translation.ko: 작은 벌새가 구애할 땐 특히나 그렇습니다

translation.en: But this male Costa's hummingbird uses his colours to send a secret message.
translation.ko: 하지만 이 코스타스벌새 수컷은 색으로 남몰래 뜻을 전합니다

translation.en: Out in the open,
flashy colours can attract unwanted attention,
translation.ko: 현란한 색을 뽐내다가는 원치 않은 이목을 끕니다

translation.en: so he keeps them hidden most of the time.
A slight turn of the head, however,
provides a tantalising glimpse of what he has to offer.
translation.ko: 숨겨 둔 색을 감질나게나마 엿볼 수 있습니다

translation.en: He's spotted a female.
She's feeding.
Hummingbirds live fast lives and need plenty of fuel.
translation.ko: 벌새는 날개를 바삐 움직이므로 그만큼 연료를 보충해야 합니다

translation.en: So if he is to attract her attention, he needs something eye-catching.
translation.ko: 그러니 암컷의 관심을 끌려면 눈길을 사로잡을 게 필요하죠

translation.en: Time to reveal his colours.
Erecting the iridescent feathers on his neck,
translation.ko: 수컷은 목에 난 광채 나는 깃털을 세우면서

translation.en: he positions himself to catch the sunlight.
Seen at just the right angle, his colours are dazzling.
translation.ko: 각도만 잘 잡으면 빛에 따라 눈부시게 반짝이죠

translation.en: Aerobatics like these take a lot of energy,
translation.ko: 구애의 춤을 펼치려면 상당한 체력이 들어서

translation.en: so his performance can give her clues about his health and fitness.
translation.ko: 암컷은 수컷의 신체적인 능력을 이를 통해 판가름하기도 합니다

translation.en: Every second she takes to decide burns up his energy reserves.
translation.ko: 암컷이 고민하는 매 순간에도 수컷은 체력을 불사르며 버팁니다

translation.en: So he can only hover for so long.
At last,
his colours have persuaded her.
Displaying your colours is easy out in the open.
translation.ko: 넓게 펼쳐진 벌판에서는 색을 과시하기가 쉽지만

translation.en: Birds which live in dark forests, however,
have to work harder to get noticed.
The rainforests of New Guinea.
Here, the trees stand 100 feet tall
with their crowns forming a near-continuous canopy.
translation.ko: 지붕처럼 이어진 수관을 이루며 빽빽이 들어서 있습니다

translation.en: But here and there,
there's a small gap through which a shaft of light
illuminates a patch on the forest floor.
A stage for one of the most versatile dancers in the natural world.
translation.ko: 자연계에서 가장 위대한 쇼맨의 이상적인 무대로 거듭나는 거죠

translation.en: A bird of paradise.
There are over 30 different species.
This one, understandably,
is called the magnificent bird of paradise.
A male.
Before starting his show,
he clears his stage.
The bare brown earth will make his colours stand out better.
translation.ko: 수컷의 색은 갈색 배경에서 더욱 돋보입니다

translation.en: He takes particular care to remove anything green.
translation.ko: 녹색을 없애는 데 특별히 주의를 기울입니다

translation.en: That colour will be the main feature of his display,
and he doesn't want any competition.
translation.ko: 다른 것에 묻히게 둘 순 없죠

translation.en: Satisfied at last.
A sapling in the centre will serve as his dancing pole.
translation.ko: 무대 중앙의 어린나무가 봉 역할을 할 겁니다

translation.en: His costume must be immaculate.
Plumes like these need careful attention.
Time to summon the audience.
The first to appear are all young males.
translation.ko: 관객이 하나둘 모여들지만 모두 어린 수컷입니다

translation.en: They won't develop their colours until they're seven years old.
They have come to watch and to learn.
At last, a female.
She looks much like a young male to our eyes,
translation.ko: 우리 눈에는 어린 수컷과 비슷해 보이지만

translation.en: but he can clearly tell the difference.
She will judge him by his performance and the brightness of his feathers.
translation.ko: 암컷은 수컷의 연기력과 깃털의 밝기를 평가합니다

translation.en: She does that from directly above him.
He puffs up his feathers and swings round to show her his colours.
translation.ko: 수컷이 깃털을 부풀려 펼치며 색을 보여 줍니다

translation.en: For years,
naturalists only watched this performance from ground level.
translation.ko: 동식물학자들은 이 모습을 아래쪽에서 보는 데 그쳤습니다

translation.en: But the female does so from above.
And from there,
his brilliant green colours stand out vividly
translation.ko: 눈부신 녹색 깃털이 갈색 땅과 대비돼

translation.en: against the brown of the ground.
A pair of bare quivering quills sprouting from his tail
translation.ko: 한 쌍의 흔들리는 깃대가 꼬리에서 돋아나

translation.en: add to the excitement.
This is one of the most complex of all courtship dances,
translation.ko: 구애의 춤을 통틀어 형태가 가장 복잡합니다

translation.en: and we're still unaware of the details that she may regard as critical.
The prize-giving, however, is unmistakable.
The colour vision of birds is mostly excellent…
but that of many insects is almost as good.
Butterflies.
They, too, have evolved an astonishing variety
of colours and patterns.
The wings are covered by tiny scales, like tiles on a roof,
translation.ko: 나비 날개는 작은 지붕 타일처럼 미세한 비늘로 뒤덮여 있는데

translation.en: and it's they that produce some of the colours.
translation.ko: 바로 이 비늘이 색을 만들어 냅니다

translation.en: Some have pigments.
Others reflect light to produce a shimmering iridescence
translation.ko: 무지갯빛으로 아롱지게 빛을 굴절하는 나비도 있습니다

translation.en: with colours that change according to the angle
from which they're viewed.
But some butterflies use colours
that are invisible to our eyes.
translation.ko: 우리 눈으로 볼 수 없기도 합니다

translation.en: The glorious colours of an English meadow in bloom
translation.ko: 꽃이 만발한 영국의 초원은 온갖 색으로 가득해

translation.en: is a delight to the eyes of many of us.
But their purpose is not to appeal to us.
translation.ko: 하지만 우리 눈에 들려고 화려한 모양새인 건 아닙니다

translation.en: It's to attract insects such as butterflies and bees.
translation.ko: 나비나 벌 같은 곤충을 끌어들이기 위해서죠

translation.en: Most of these plants depend on insects to pollinate them,
and they use their bright colours in order to attract insects.
translation.ko: 그래서 곤충을 유혹하려고 화려한 색으로 중무장하죠

translation.en: But to understand what an insect sees,
translation.ko: 하지만 곤충이 보는 세계를 이해하기 위해선

translation.en: we have to be able to see it through their eyes
and from their perspective.
And, happily, we've got a camera that enables us to do just that.
translation.ko: 다행히도 이를 가능하게 하는 카메라가 있습니다

translation.en: This camera setup lets us look at that flower in two different ways.
translation.ko: 카메라를 이렇게 설정하면 꽃을 두 형상으로 볼 수 있습니다

translation.en: This camera is an ultraviolet camera
because it has a filter there that only lets through ultraviolet light.
But, at the same time, this filter also reflects normal light,
translation.ko: 하지만 그와 동시에 정상 광선은 반사해서

translation.en: and that comes into this camera, and that shows what we can see.
translation.ko: 이쪽 카메라로 비춰 우리 눈에 보이는 색을 나타내죠

translation.en: So I can compare the two very easily.
translation.ko: 그래서 두 형상을 쉽게 비교할 수 있어요

translation.en: That's what we can see…
and that's what the insect sees.
Flowers have evolved these ultraviolet markings
for the benefit of insects such as butterflies.
translation.ko: 나비와 같은 곤충을 위해 진화해 왔습니다

translation.en: This particular one lives in the rainforests of Eastern Australia.
translation.ko: 호주 동부 열대 우림에서 그 예를 만나 봅시다

translation.en: It's a blue moon butterfly.
A male.
You might not think that it's the most colourful you've ever seen,
translation.ko: 그동안 본 나비들과 다르게 화려하진 않습니다

translation.en: but with our ultraviolet camera,
his wings take on a magical look.
The brighter his patches, the more attractive he is to females.
translation.ko: 자외선 무늬가 밝을수록 암컷에게 인기를 끕니다

translation.en: But ultraviolet markings like these
can also be seen by the blue moon's main predators.
translation.ko: 남방오색나비의 주요 포식자도 볼 수 있습니다

translation.en: Birds can see them just as clearly.
So flying around with a bright signal like that on your wings
translation.ko: 그래서 날개에 밝은 신호를 달고 함부로 날아다니는 건

translation.en: could be dangerous.
For a male, however, it's worth living dangerously.
translation.ko: 수컷에게는 이런 위험을 감수할 가치가 충분합니다

translation.en: If he can mate with one or two females in his short lifetime,
translation.ko: 짧은 일생 동안 암컷 한두 마리와 교미하기만 해도

translation.en: his colours will have been a success.
But he has competition.
He will have to defend his territory if he's to secure a mate.
translation.ko: 짝을 뺏기지 않으려면 자신의 영역을 지켜야 합니다

translation.en: Butterfly wings are fragile, so physical combat is to be avoided.
translation.ko: 나비는 날개가 연약해서 물리적으로 싸우진 않습니다

translation.en: Disputes, instead, are settled with aerial displays.
translation.ko: 대신 공중 곡예를 펼치며 분쟁을 해결하죠

translation.en: A female has been watching from the sidelines.
Time to show her his colours.
translation.ko: 이때를 놓치지 말고 색을 뽐내야 합니다

translation.en: In her eyes, he's simply dazzling.
translation.ko: 암컷의 눈에는 수컷이 그야말로 빛나 보입니다

translation.en: Ultraviolet colours are part of the spectrum
that insects can see and we cannot.
translation.ko: 곤충은 볼 수 있지만 우리는 보지 못합니다

translation.en: Recent discoveries have revealed
that some animals can also see a characteristic of light
that we cannot detect.
Sunlight contains rays that vibrate in many different planes.
translation.ko: 햇빛은 모든 방향으로 진동하는 데 반해

translation.en: In polarised light, they vibrate in only one.
Light may become polarised
when reflected off a shiny surface such as water.
translation.ko: 물처럼 반짝이는 표면에 빛이 반사하면 나타나죠

translation.en: Unlike us, some animals can see polarised light,
translation.ko: 우리와 달리 어떤 동물은 편광을 보고

translation.en: and they can exploit it in many ways.
One creature that does so
lives on these vast mudflats in Northern Australia.
translation.ko: 호주 북부의 널따란 갯벌에 사는 생물을 들 수 있습니다

translation.en: These eyes, on stalks, belong to a male fiddler crab.
translation.ko: 기다란 눈자루 끝에 달린 수컷 농게의 눈입니다

translation.en: And they can see in a way that we cannot.
translation.ko: 우리가 보지 못하는 세계를 이 눈으로 봅니다

translation.en: As the tide goes out, the crabs emerge from their burrows.
translation.ko: 썰물로 물이 빠져나가자 농게가 모래 굴에서 나옵니다

translation.en: His giant claw is too large to be used in feeding.
Instead, he uses it to attract the attention of females
translation.ko: 대신 암컷의 관심을 끌고 유혹할 때

translation.en: by waving it with vigour.
The crabs can see objects that are close to them reasonably well…
translation.ko: 가까이 있는 것들은 농게도 잘 보지만

translation.en: but their long-distance eyesight is not so good.
translation.ko: 먼 거리에 있는 것은 그다지 잘 못 봅니다

translation.en: Polarised light can help solve the problem.
Viewed with a new specialist camera,
the mudflats, which reflect polarised light,
are bright…
while the unpolarised crabs appear darker against their background.
translation.ko: 반면에 비편광된 농게는 배경에 비해 어두워 보이죠

translation.en: This striking contrast also makes the large claw more obvious.
translation.ko: 뚜렷한 대조 덕분에 큰 집게발도 더 선명하게 보입니다

translation.en: The big claw is also used by the male to defend his burrow.
translation.ko: 커다란 집게발은 수컷이 굴을 지킬 때도 쓰입니다

translation.en: Not everyone heeds the warning.
Battle over.
But there are more dangerous enemies to face.
Aerial predators.
The quicker they can spot them the better.
And, once again, polarised light helps them to do so.
translation.ko: 이때 편광이 다시 한번 큰 역할을 하죠

translation.en: With the coast clear,
a male reemerges from his burrow.
At last, a female.
With the tide on the turn,
he must work fast to win her over.
And close up,
his colours come into play.
The brightness of his blue back could be the deciding factor.
translation.ko: 선명하게 푸른 등딱지가 환심을 사는 주요 변수입니다

translation.en: She may not look willing,
but the pushing and shoving are all part of the mating ritual.
One last shove
and she's in.
Just in time.
On land, colour is used in a multitude of different ways.
The same is true in the sea,
but there, colour works in a very different way.
translation.ko: 대신 전혀 다른 방식으로 색이 자기 소임을 다하죠

translation.en: This is Australia's Great Barrier Reef,
and its shallow waters are full of vivid colour.
translation.ko: 얕은 수심 아래 색의 향연이 펼쳐집니다

translation.en: The inhabitants of the reef exploit it to the full
translation.ko: 산호초에 서식하는 물고기들은 색을 극도로 활용하고

translation.en: with unparalleled and dazzling effect.
translation.ko: 색은 비할 데 없이 눈부신 효과를 자랑합니다

translation.en: The orange-red stripes of the harlequin tuskfish
make it very conspicuous.
But as light filters down through the water,
more and more of its wavelengths are absorbed,
translation.ko: 깊이 들어갈수록 빛의 파장이 흡수되기 때문에

translation.en: and red is the first to disappear.
So as the harlequin swims downwards,
his brilliantly coloured red body looks duller and duller.
Different colours are absorbed at different rates in the sea,
but some can still be seen at greater depths.
Yellow and blue travel farthest,
so it's these that many fish down here use to signal their identity.
translation.ko: 많은 물고기가 이런 색 조합으로 존재감을 내뿜습니다

translation.en: Most fish near the surface have good colour vision,
translation.ko: 표면 가까이 사는 물고기는 대다수가 색각이 뛰어난데

translation.en: but some of the smaller species can also see ultraviolet colours.
translation.ko: 크기가 작은 종은 자외선 색깔을 보기도 합니다

translation.en: To us, these yellow damselfish all look very similar.
translation.ko: 우리 눈에는 노란 자리돔들이 다 비슷해 보입니다

translation.en: But using our ultraviolet camera,
we can see that many fish have different patterns
translation.ko: 무늬가 저마다 다르다는 것을 알 수 있습니다

translation.en: that are normally invisible to our eyes.
And suddenly,
it becomes clear that these two individuals
are, in fact, different species.
translation.ko: 서로 다른 종이라는 것을 알게 되죠

translation.en: This lemon damselfish has distinctive spots on its gill covers.
translation.ko: 이 레몬자리돔은 아감딱지의 독특한 반점이 특징입니다

translation.en: And this, an Ambon damsel,
has bright reflecting ultraviolet patches all across the body.
translation.ko: 밝은 자외선 무늬가 온몸에 퍼져 있습니다

translation.en: It's a code invisible to us
that allows these fish to recognise each other…
without attracting the attention of large predators,
translation.ko: 더 큰 포식자의 시선을 끌 일도 없습니다

translation.en: which can't see in the ultraviolet range.
translation.ko: 포식자들이 자외선 영역을 보지 못하기 때문이죠

translation.en: And it's on the seabed
that you can find one of the most colourful sea creatures of all.
translation.ko: 아름다운 색을 자랑하는 해양 생물을 찾아볼 수 있습니다

translation.en: The peacock mantis shrimp.
This strange-looking creature's ancestry
translation.ko: 기이하게 생긴 이 해양 생물의 조상을 찾으려면

translation.en: can be traced back 400 million years,
and it has one of the most versatile kinds of eyes
in the whole of the animal kingdom.
It can rotate its two huge eyes independently of each other
translation.ko: 툭 튀어나온 눈은 서로 따로 놀면서

translation.en: and in almost any direction.
translation.ko: 거의 모든 방향으로 회전시킬 수 있습니다

translation.en: We have three kinds of colour receptors,
translation.ko: 사람은 3색을 볼 수 있는 데 반해

translation.en: but the mantis shrimp has 12,
each with a direct link to the brain,
so it can perceive colour faster than any other animal.
And it can also detect the difference between polarised and unpolarised light.
But unlike fiddler crabs,
part of its body, like these paddle-shaped scales,
translation.ko: 패들 모양의 비늘과 같은 몸의 일부를

translation.en: reflect polarised light
and may be used to signal to potential mates.
translation.ko: 미래의 짝에게 신호를 보낼 수 있습니다

translation.en: The tail is also highly polarised and used to plug its burrow
and send a message to warn off potential rivals.
And by combining all its visual abilities,
translation.ko: 이런 시각 능력을 갖추고 있다 보니

translation.en: the mantis shrimp has become one of the most skilful of all predators.
It also packs a powerful punch from club-like mouthparts…
translation.ko: 곤봉처럼 생긴 구기 기관으로 강력한 펀치도 구사하죠

translation.en: which it uses with great accuracy.
These clubs deliver the fastest punch in the animal kingdom,
translation.ko: 동물의 세계에서 가장 빠른 펀치로 이미 유명합니다

translation.en: and it's guided by its extraordinary vision.
translation.ko: 이 모든 게 놀라운 시각 능력 덕분입니다

translation.en: Whether underwater or on land,
colour can be extremely useful.
And the colours an animal develops
can sometimes be influenced by where it lives and what it eats.
translation.ko: 사는 환경과 먹이의 영향을 크게 받기도 합니다

translation.en: The Atacama Desert in South America.
There are six different species of flamingos in the world,
and they all prefer to breed in those most hostile of environments,
translation.ko: 하나같이 혹한 환경에서 번식하는 것을 선호합니다

translation.en: salt flats and soda lakes.
We think of flamingos as being characteristically pink,
but their feathers, when they first appear,
are, in fact, white.
Their colour comes from their food.
The salty waters in which they feed are rich in algae and shrimps,
translation.ko: 소금물에 홍학의 먹이인 조류와 새우가 풍부한데

translation.en: both of which contain red pigments called carotenoids.
translation.ko: 붉은 색소 물질인 카로티노이드가 이 먹이에 함유돼 있습니다

translation.en: These, over time,
accumulate in their feathers and give them their bright colour.
translation.ko: 깃털에 색소가 축적됨에 따라 홍학은 밝은 분홍색을 띱니다

translation.en: These youngsters were born last year.
They still have their first greyish-white plumage.
It takes time before the pigments become visible.
Five years will pass
before they become as pink as their parents.
But it's not only the juveniles which are white.
This adult female raised a chick last year,
translation.ko: 이 암컷 성체는 작년에 새끼를 기르면서

translation.en: and the effort of doing so has drained her of colour.
translation.ko: 힘든 육아 활동으로 깃털의 색이 빠졌습니다

translation.en: She put all her surplus food and energy
into producing an egg and then feeding her chick.
translation.ko: 알을 낳고 새끼를 기르는 데 모조리 쏟아붓습니다

translation.en: So she will need time to build up the body reserves needed
translation.ko: 번식에 적합한 몸으로 회복하고 분홍색 깃털을 기르려면

translation.en: to regrow pink feathers and breed.
For those that are old enough and physically fit,
translation.ko: 나이도 차고 생식 능력도 충분한 홍학들은

translation.en: it's time to find a mate.
Only the pink birds take part in these courtship dances.
translation.ko: 분홍색 홍학만이 모여서 구애의 춤을 춥니다

translation.en: Their colour is an indication that they're fit and strong.
As they march through the water,
each bird tries to stand out from the crowd,
and the brightest will be the first to secure a partner.
translation.ko: 가장 밝은색을 띠는 홍학이 제일 먼저 짝짓기에 성공합니다

translation.en: The white female can play no part in this year's display.
translation.ko: 깃털이 하얀 암컷은 올해 번식 무리에서 소외됩니다

translation.en: She will need to eat as much as she can if she is to restore her colour.
translation.ko: 먹이를 최대한 먹으며 분홍색을 되찾는 게 먼저죠

translation.en: Maybe next year she will be able to rejoin the dance.
translation.ko: 그러면 내년에는 구애의 춤을 출 수 있을지 모릅니다

translation.en: Flamingos depend on their pink colour to attract a partner and breed.
translation.ko: 홍학에게 분홍색은 구애 수단이자 번식의 필수 요소입니다

translation.en: But there is one tiny animal in the Central American rainforests
translation.ko: 하지만 중앙아메리카 열대 우림의 어느 작은 동물은

translation.en: that uses colour not only to attract,
but to repel.
This little frog uses colour as a warning.
Its skin is full of glands which produce a deadly poison.
translation.ko: 피부에 가득한 분비샘이 치명적인 독을 생성하니

translation.en: So its colour is a very clear message.
"Eat me and you'll regret it."
You need a vivid message like this
if you are a small, soft-skinned, bite-sized mouthful
translation.ko: 부드러운 피부로 뒤덮인 한 입 거리 크기의 개구리가

translation.en: living in a dark, dense forest.
translation.ko: 어둡고 울창한 숲에서 살 땐 더욱 그렇죠

translation.en: The rainforest can be a scary place.
translation.ko: 열대 우림은 때때로 무서울 수 있습니다

translation.en: There are hungry animals everywhere.
For many, it's best to keep a low profile.
translation.ko: 최대한 눈에 띄지 않는 편이 좋습니다

translation.en: But this little frog doesn't.
It's a strawberry poison dart frog,
and it's not much bigger than your fingernail.
And yet he is one of the deadliest creatures here.
His bright skin secretes a toxin.
translation.ko: 밝은 피부 아래로 독소를 품고 있어

translation.en: In the mouth of a predator,
translation.ko: 함부로 입에 넣었다간 호흡기 마비와 경련으로

translation.en: it can cause respiratory failure, convulsions, and death.
translation.ko: 함부로 입에 넣었다간 호흡기 마비와 경련으로 사망에까지 이를 수 있습니다

translation.en: Predators recognise his colour as a sign of danger and avoid him.
translation.ko: 포식자들은 피부 색깔로 위험을 알아보고 피합니다

translation.en: Such frogs also live on a group of islands just off Panama
translation.ko: 이 개구리는 파나마 외곽에 위치한 제도인

translation.en: called Bocas del Toro.
Living in isolation,
frogs on each island evolved their own distinctive colours.
translation.ko: 각 섬의 개구리는 고유한 색으로 진화했습니다

translation.en: There is a different one on each island.
translation.ko: 다른 색깔의 개구리가 각 섬에 살지만

translation.en: And yet they're all the same species.
They're different because the diet on some islands
translation.ko: 섬에서 먹는 먹이에 따라 색이 다른데

translation.en: makes some more poisonous than others.
translation.ko: 그래서 일부 개구리는 독성이 더 강하기도 합니다

translation.en: And the more poison a frog has, the more brightly coloured it is.
On Solarte Island,
a red male is busy calling.
translation.ko: 빨간 수컷 개구리가 바쁘게 울어 댑니다

translation.en: This is his patch, and he's looking for a female.
He should be popular.
Females prefer bright, shiny skin,
which is a sign of fitness.
His colour is also an indication to other males of his strength.
translation.ko: 색깔은 다른 수컷에게 힘을 알리는 지표기도 합니다

translation.en: He spots an intruder.
He's about the same size, but he's a paler colour.
And he doesn't challenge the brighter frog.
translation.ko: 색이 더 밝은 수컷에게 덤빌 생각도 안 합니다

translation.en: But this one is a different matter.
He is a contender.
Nothing for it but to fight it out.
translation.ko: 이럴 땐 싸워서 우위를 가려야 합니다

translation.en: That did it.
He won't be back for a while.
translation.ko: 진 쪽은 당분간 보이지 않을 겁니다

translation.en: And the reward,
a new mate.
For these tiny frogs,
colour is central to all aspects of their lives.
translation.ko: 색깔은 삶의 모든 측면에서 중대한 역할을 합니다

translation.en: For protection,
to dominate rivals, and to find a partner.
translation.ko: 경쟁자를 물리치고 짝을 얻게 해 주죠

translation.en: For them, life is colour.
In the next episode, the story of Life in Colour continues,
where the stakes are even higher,
and colour is the key to survival.
translation.ko: 생존의 핵심이 되는 색의 역할을 살펴봅니다

translation.en: We discover how animals use colour to hide from predators
translation.ko: 포식자의 눈을 피하고 먹이의 눈을 속이려고

translation.en: and from their prey.
